sentences.english: I thought you promised to capture him by expanding teh Afghan troops.
sentences.chinese: 我记得你承诺过会通过在阿富汗扩军而抓住他。

sentences.english: Claudius, the Emperor of Rome, wanted to increase the size of his army.
sentences.chinese: 罗马的皇帝，克洛蒂斯，想要扩军。

sentences.english: Gates said all parties involved agree on the need to move as quickly as possible to expand the Afghan forces.
sentences.chinese: 盖茨表示，所有各方都同意要尽快落实扩军计划。

sentences.english: President Bush is asking Congress for money for another troop surge.
sentences.chinese: 布什总统向国会提出资金请求以欲再一次扩军。

sentences.english: That is why I am such a strong supporter of accelerating the expansion of the Afghan army.
sentences.chinese: 这也是我为什么坚决支持加快阿富汗扩军的速度。

definition: to expand (esp. by new recruitment)/to increase the army/to augment
to reinforce/to increase troop numbers/reinforcements/extra troops
New Armies (modernized Qing armies, trained and equipped according to Western standards, founded after Japan's victory in the First Sino-Japanese War in 1895)
an expedition, esp. military/march to remote regions
to enlist/to draft/to conscript/to appoint to an official position
to go to war/to engage in war
lit. to form an army/to set up (team, group, band, organization etc)/to found/opening (ceremony)/to commission (arms system, naval vessel)/to graduate from an apprenticeship
to recruit soldiers and buy horses (idiom); to raise a large army/fig. to expand business/to recruit new staff
